Stem: Thin seed head stems, hairless and smooth, often bending at nodes.
Leaves: Flat blade up to 8 cm long sometimes hairy, often with wrinkled edges, spread quite wide.
FruitSeeds: Spikes in finger like arrangement, with overlapping spikelets. Contain 5-11 seeds per spikelet. Entire spikes are shed from plant to disperse seeds.
Habitat: River banks, floodplains, swamps, pastures, grassland.
Impacts: Reduces crop yield, important food for plague locusts, can be toxic to stock in high doses.

Photos.Caption: Small low grass often with many seed heads
